parameter.name: P119
parameter.usage: Used to configure File types for bulk file upload with permissions.
parameter.description: COMPANY_ID - * KEY_1 - Bank Abbv Name - Determines Whether particular file type can be uploaded for the bank KEY_2 - Product Type - For Portal sub product code of FT (INT, DOM etc). This should be set as "*" for FLEXI mode. DATA_2 - Email 1 (Y/N) KEY_3 - Product Group - For portal sub product code for BK (COLLE - collections,PAYMT- Payments KEY_4 - Map Code - Actual Name of Map_ to be sent to Data mapper (nothing but FT),PAYRL - Payroll) DATA_4 - Phone (Y/N) DATA_1 - File Type - Type of the file to be uploaded. This is displayed for the customer based on permission (Payroll-INT Standard,payroll - INT Special etc) DATA_2 - Permission Name - Permission to display file type (ft_bulk_bp_ibg_std_upload etc) DATA_3 - Format Name in file system (SG_INT_PAY_COLL,SG_INT<PAY_WITH_Advice) DATA_5 - Format Type - Fixed or CSV will be passed to DataMapper (Fixed,CSV) DATA_6 - Header Account Level Flag (Y/N) - Field to specify whether account is mandatory while uploading DATA_7 - Header Value date Level flag (Y/N) - Field to specify whether value date is mandatory while uploading DATA_8 - Amendable (Y/N) DATA_9 - Multi Product Group (Y/N) DATA_10 - Multi Entity allowed (Y/N) N for Singapore DATA_11 - File Encrypted (Y/N) - File being uploaded in encrypted. DATA_12 - Payroll Type (Employee, Executive etc) DATA_12 - Compressed File Type DATA_13 - Fixed table for advise DATA_14 - Override Duplicate Customer Reference Check (Y/N) DATA_15 - Restrict from Merge.

parameter.name: P763
parameter.usage: This parameter is used for configuring the message sequence of incoming TMA messages to process it. From KEY_3 on wards the message types should be configured, along with unique identifier in DATA_3 on wards respectively Note that message types should be configured in asc order. If there is a event submitted from the Portal and it required some set of messages as response, we need to configure the pending message as well in the sequnece of parameter. DATA_2 should be Y for cases when there is action pending from the customer for an event. For example: An Initialbaselinesubmission(019) event submitted from FBCC requires 3 messages 001, 018, 010 from TMA hence in the parameter configuration requires 019 as well as one of the key.
parameter.description: COMPANY_ID - company_id KEY_1 - product code KEY_2 - Event type KEY_3 - message type DATA_1 - actual message sequence to be processed as per the ISO standared, separated by delimiter ":" DATA_2 - Y/N - Whether this event requires any action(like accept/reject) from the portal side, based on which event in progress flad is set to "Y". eg: For a TMA initiated IO amendment, the buyer has to accept/reject the amendment, no other event should be allowed till this action is completed. The values is set as "Y", based on this condition, the TM master will be updated with event in progress flag. DATA_3 - Unique identifier for the message type in KEY_3 eg: 1. If message 015 has this as the identifier value "//SubmitrPropsdBaselnRef/Submitr/BIC_//SellrBk/BIC", both are xpaths in the xml message, and their values have to be same. 2. If message 011 has this as the identifier value "//RptTp/Tp_CURR://EstblishdBaselnId/AmdmntSeqNb_*", we have two conditions to validate, which are separated by a ":" a) value at xpath location //RptTp/Tp, in the message, should be equal to "CURR", b) value at xpath location //EstblishdBaselnId/AmdmntSeqNb, in the message, should not be null/empty.

parameter.name: P764
parameter.usage: This parameter used to configure the hours in report scheduling. If this parameter is configured it will enable to configure report at a particular hour and minute. Infact, it supports the configuration of maximum number of reports that a company can schedule as well number of records that a report can fetch from database.
parameter.description: COMPANY_ID - company id of customer/bank/bank group to which the Report parameter is configured. KEY_1 - owner abbv name DATA_1 - Maximum number of reports that can configured for report scheduling(* - means no limit for the report scheduling) DATA_2 - Maximum number of records to be fetched from the report (*- means all records to be fetched from the report) DATA_3 - hours in 24 hours format separated by delimiter : in ascending order DATA_4 - Default hour.Warning - to be configured from one of the value in DATA_3 only

KEY_1 - product code KEY_2 - sub-product code DATA_1 - Y/N flag tells whether error floating window is enabled for this product/subproduct (Y/N)

parameter.description: Below are required key and data columns for configuring this parameter, GTP_PARAM_DATA PARM_ID - unique parameter id generated for a company and user.
